sentence.Network_en: A vibraphone is a jazz instrument that was invented around 1920.
sentence.Network_cn: 电颤琴是一种爵士乐乐器,于1920年左右发明的.

sentence.Network_en: Mounted on a roof , one of the systems looks vaguely like a giant vibraphone.
sentence.Network_cn: 近些年的技术进步将成本降了下来.

铁琴（VIBRAPHONE）又叫钢片琴、颤音琴，是一种附有电气共鸣装置的敲击乐器，形制与木琴相似，发声明亮圆润，晶莹剔透，颤 …
电颤琴（Vibraphone），一种打击乐器，与木琴和马林巴琴有亲缘关系。用木棍或木槌敲击金属条演奏。

entry.def: A vibraphone is an electronic musical instrument which consists of a set of metal bars in a frame. When you hit the bars they produce ringing notes that last for some time.

means.word_mean: 1. a percussion instrument similar to a xylophone but having metal bars and rotating disks in the resonators that produce a vibrato sound
